alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Hancock (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:48AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Baldwin and southwestern Hancock Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 248 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Oconee Springs Park to near Meriwether to Browns Crossing, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Milledgeville, Midway-Hardwick, Meriwether, Devereux, Beulah, Underwood, Hardwick, Browns Crossing, Allenwood, Linton, Pancras and Scottsboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
